headline: Affirm CEO says 'demise' of the American consumer is 'greatly exaggerated'
summary: Affirm CEO Max Levchin says the consumer is "performing" and demand is "tremendous," but the stock market isn't ready to celebrate just yet.

raw.headline: Affirm CEO says 'demise' of the American consumer is 'greatly exaggerated'
raw.summary: Affirm CEO Max Levchin says the consumer is "performing" and demand is "tremendous," but the stock market isn't ready to celebrate just yet.

headline: Shuffle Board: PayPal Replaces CEO
summary: Following a fraught fourth quarter, PayPal is replacing CEO Alex Chriss with its board chair and former HP executive, Enrique Lores.

raw.headline: Shuffle Board: PayPal Replaces CEO
raw.summary: Following a fraught fourth quarter, PayPal is replacing CEO Alex Chriss with its board chair and former HP executive, Enrique Lores.

headline: Affirm Positions for Long-Term Growth. The Fintech Is More Than Just Buy Now, Pay Later.
summary: The company’s chief operating officer said he wasn’t bothered by the noise.  “There’s a reason to get excited about what we’re up to, but a lot needs to be digested,” Michael Linford said in an interview with Barron’s.  At a glance, quarterly earnings were strong.

raw.headline: Affirm Positions for Long-Term Growth. The Fintech Is More Than Just Buy Now, Pay Later.

headline: PayPal: Buy The Dip, If You Want To Gamble
summary: PayPal stock plunged 20% after weak Q4 earnings and a worse FY2026 outlook. Read why I don't think buying the dip here is a good idea.

raw.headline: PayPal: Buy The Dip, If You Want To Gamble
raw.summary: PayPal stock plunged 20% after weak Q4 earnings and a worse FY2026 outlook. Read why I don't think buying the dip here is a good idea.

headline: Ex-PayPal President David Marcus Says 'Defensive' BNPL Strategy Handed PYPL's Market Share To Rivals, Leading To Stagnant Growth
summary: Following a 20% collapse in PayPal Holdings Inc.‘s (NASDAQ:PYPL) stock price and the abrupt removal of CEO Alex Chriss, former company president David Marcus has broken a twelve-year silence to critique a culture of “financial optimization” that he claims has hollowed out the payments pioneer. Legacy Of Optimization Marcus, who led PayPal until 2014 before moving to Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META), attributed the company's current struggles to a long-term shift away from product-led innovation

headline: Cathie Wood Loads Up On Coinbase, Circle, Robinhood As Crypto Market Gripped By 'Extreme Fear' Amid Bitcoin Crash
summary: On Tuesday, Cathie Wood-led Ark Invest executed significant trades, including purchases of Circle Internet Group Inc. (NYSE:CRCL), Coinbase Global Inc. (NASDAQ:COIN), Robinhood Markets Inc. (NASDAQ:HOOD), ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF (BATS:ARKB), and Bitmine Immersion Technologies Inc. (NYSE:BMNR). These trades occurred as the cryptocurrency market faced extreme volatility, with major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin experiencing notable declines.
